data.description:
A watch face that also keeps tabs of your growing (or shrinking) share stock value - you enter the stock symbol, the price you bought it for, and the quantity and the watch face will show the current value you have gained (or lost). International stock markets (eg. Australia) require adding a prefix (eg. LNG.AX) to correctly lookup the prices.

Settings allow for top or bottom time location, black or white face, and choose between showing the share $ total, share $ gain, or percent.

There is a Pro version that allows for multiple shares to ticker scroll into view allowing you to watch several shares with speed control options etc.

latest_release.release_notes: Added snooze feature for Pro users which stops the share ticker scrolling when watch is not moving

data.title: ShareTime

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time, Pebble 2, Pebble Time 2 and configuration to support color changing

data.description:
A cryptic analog based watchface.

The outer blocks are the hour (fatter) and 5-minutes (thinner) in traditional positions. The additional 4 minutes, for accuracy, are in the middle.

Both colors are configurable.


Screenshots: 6:26, 6:32, 2:06, 4:24, 11:22


This design, created by Justin Schofield, originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.

The original design, with example times, can be found here: 

http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/05/06/squared²-e-paper-watch-black-white-pixel-art/

Note that the hour is now the fatter block and the 5-minute the thinner one - we thought that would be more intuitive.

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time, Pebble 2, Pebble Time 2 and configuration to support color changing

changelog.release_notes: Bug Fixes, less memory use.

Double tap to change from 'Graphic' to 'Text'.
First bar shows time in format "00:00" (ie. 09:12), second bar show Day in month (ie. 14) and third bar shows month (ie. 01).
Double tap changes back to 'Bar Graph'.
Every minute it changes back to 'Graphic' if it's showing 'Text'.
First Release

data.description:
Shows graphically how much time you still have untill the year ends.
The first bar shows how much of the day have gone.
The second bar shows how many days have gone from the current month.
The third bar shows how many months have gone.

Kudos to Marcelo Ceccon, the guy with the idea.

New in version 1.1:
Double tap to change between "Graphic" and "Text" modes.

New in version 1.2:
Bug fix: now it goes back to "Graphic" when minute changes.
data.title: Ending Soon

data.description:
This face focuses on being easy to read and having data available at a glance.

The solid hand inside the ring is for hours and the hollow hand on the outside is for minutes. 

Features: (All are configurable/optional!)
- Weather (Requires GPS)
--- Variable update frequency & caching (data expires 10 minutes after missed update)
--- Metric & Imperial Units
--- 35 different weather indicators ('CLEAR', 'RAIN', etc.) Some are abbreviated.
- Battery Indicator (text & graphical)
- Bluetooth Disconnected Indicator
- Vibrate on Bluetooth (dis)connect
- Both analog & digital time

If you have any suggestions or ideas for another WatchFace, feel free to let me know!

latest_release.release_notes:
1.1 ADDED:  
  
Graphical battery indicator option!  
AM/PM indicators!  
Faster response to loss of bt!  
Faster response to changes in batter state!  
Battery indication now reads "full" when charging is complete!

data.description:
A clear watchface with date, current weather at your location and which vibrates the Pebble to tell the time at the hour and half-hour using the traditional Ship Bell patterns:
   12:30 = 1-Bell [vibe].
   13:00 = 2-Bells [vibe-vibe].
   13:30 = 3-Bells [vibe-vibe <pause> vibe]. etc
   16:00 = 8-Bells [You get the idea, yes?]

Configuration options:
   - Turn on/off the half-hour bells.
   - Turn on/off the quarter-hour bells.
   - Select when the bells sound from and to.
   - Change the watch face colour scheme.

v2.0 has updated the fond from the defaults to using Droid Sans.

latest_release.release_notes:
Updated the Battery to be a Line rather than a value and %.
Corrected a font-size that was extending beyond the screen width.

data.title: Ships Bells

data.author: Timmins Technologies, LLC

changelog.release_notes: Complete rewrite of parts of the battery handling code which caused countless untold crashes. Also should use less battery due to other bugs found.

Timeline support is official now. Hi, fellow pebble time users!
Please go into the watchface settings to turn on the timeline data I'm adding. It's best effort, including things like shard jump times, shard scoring, and measurement start/end for North American anomalies (sorry, going to focus on EU a bit later!)
Proper timezone support for Pebble Time. (Shhh!)
Color Support: Adjusted colors to ones that look awesome on the real thing.
Fixed broken color icon in Enlightened App - Just a version bump for the Resistance one.

App storage writes in the bluetooth comm module seem to affect stability. As a result, we check to see if the write needs to be made by checking the received offset versus the currently operating offset. This limits write activities and should avoid crashes.

Added persistence for timezones so a dead phone doesn't mean you won't know what checkpoint is, provided you were in the right timezone when it died.

Added Pebble Color support (!)

* Removes vibrate on BT connected (meaning it doesn't vibrate when you start the watchface)
* Decreases required GPS precision and fix time - it either gets a fix and a region, or it bails and at least gives you a time offset quickly
* Decreases app logging, which ironically should fix the final crash bugs. *sigh*
Clean up the heap a little better. 3rd push today, this one's just for better practices. Contains the anti-crash and anti-bloodlust patches of the last two, but now uses less watch memory!

One more bug caused by a previous bug fix that caused the watch to enter a endless update loop under some circumstances where the phone was previously told "no matter what, never send an update more than X minutes" - The watch doesn't like being told no and asked repeatedly, once a second. It doesn't do that anymore, and the phone also always does what it is asked.
Sated the watch's thirst for battery and the blood of innocents. 100% less crashes, same great functionality when it isn't busy crashing.

Major changes include seconds display (only shows countdown in seconds within 5 minutes of checkpoint) date display, timezone fixes (sorry about that! I tested throughly this time, and support +0:30 offsets and other stuff now) and changes to battery indication. FUTURE RELEASE PLANS: AM/PM preferences, changeable/removable faction logo, and display of UTC time.
Initial Release

data.description:
The watchface displays: 
* The current septicycle 
* The current checkpoint out of 35 
* A countdown to the next checkpoint 
* The current time (24h format) 
* Bluetooth status 
* Watch Battery Level (and charge status) 
* Ingress Scoring Region you are currently in (AM01-KILO-02, for example) 
* The next 3 checkpoints 
* And most importantly, the Resistance Key! 

All times displayed are in the timezone of your handset. The application should work worldwide, though there will be issues calculating the region at the poles.

latest_release.release_notes: Complete rewrite of parts of the battery handling code which caused countless untold crashes. Also should use less battery due to other bugs found.

data.title: Ingress Resistance Cycle Time

data.author: Geek Sleek

changelog.release_notes: Initial release

data.description:
Featuing a hand-made pixelart background based on the title screen of Super Metroid.  Functionality includes a AM/PM/24h time display, day of the week, current date, charging animation, and Bluetooth disconnect notification.

AM/PM/24h mode is based on the system setting found under Settings > Date & Time > Time Display.

Upon connection to a charger the baby Metroid will hover up and down in its containment chamber.

The Bluetooth disconnected icon will appear and the Pebble will vibrate when Bluetooth communication has been lost for more than 3 seconds.
data.title: Bounty Hunter

data.author: Ankit Pyasi

changelog.release_notes:
- Changed the Bluetooth disconnect indicator. It now shows on top and prettier.
- The battery bar will show "Charge me!" when drops below 10% of charge.

- Back to clutter free layout.
- Reversed battery colors.
- BT disconnect indicator only visible when disconnected.
- Short vibes only for disconnect.

- Added Bluetooth state toggle. Filled toggle for connected, and hollow for disconnected.
- Short pulse vibration for Bluetooth dis-connect and re-connect.

- Fixed charging text.
- Added support for French, German and Spanish.
- Added separator for month and day of month.

Leaner app size. (Reduced by half by better defined resources).
No change in functionality or looks.
Clock time is a tad bigger now.Weekday will be abbreviated if too long to fit. Improved battery status peek. Menu icon is bit prettier now.
Initial Release.

data.description:
- Now supports French, German and Spanish.

A clean and simple watch-face giving you all the information you need in a glance. 

Shows :

- Time (12h/24h depending on system setting)

- Full/Abv. Month of the year (space permitted)

- Day of the month

- Full/Abv. Day of the week (space permitted)

- Bluetooth disconnect indicator. Short pulse vibration for Bluetooth dis-connection.

And as the name suggests :

- Battery status (Shows the charge left. Also shows remaining charge percent and "Charging.." when plugged in). When battery level drops to 10% it will say "Charge me!" on the battery bar.

latest_release.release_notes:

data.description: This takes the time translates it into words. It doesn't just tell the time on the five-minute marks. If it is just a minute past it adds "-ish" to the time, like it is "Five-ish after Three".  If it os 3:07, the watch will say "A bit after Five-ish after Three". For 3:03 the time will be "About Five after Three" and for 3:04 it will say "Almost Five after Three".

data.description:
Be transported to magical olden times when you strap on this beauty.  This watch loses or gains several minutes a day, depending on how much it's been wound, where winding is accomplished by switching out and back into the face.  Additionally, it believes that every month has 31 days.  You reset to the correct time and date by fully winding the watch.
(Note that this face is a very slight modification of the "simple_analog" face from the Pebble SDK examples.)

data.description:
It tells time in mixed number in simplest form.

For example, if it's 8:30 am, it will display 8½.

It allows you to know what fraction of the hour has passed. It trains your brain by practicing your maths.

If you are in a hurry or want to show some magic, you could shake your watch and it will reveal the minutes. For example, if it's 8:30am, you could shake the watch to see 8 30/60.

Additional Features: 
You can choose your own background and text colors
Support 12h or 24h time display
Shake to display weekday name and day of the month

Age requirements: 8 or above

data.author: Michael Fisher

changelog.release_notes:
You wanted it...you got it!

WeatherFish is now configurable so you can show the temperature in Fahrenheit or Celsius. If you need/want some other scale, build your own app...weirdo.
Small update to remove zero-padding on the 12-hour time.

Added Bluetooth status indicator, and battery status indicator. Also added AM/PM indicator for those who prefer a 12 hour clock. For Bluetooth notification, the watch will vibrate with 3 long pulses if disconnected, and 3 short pulses when it reconnects.
Updated appearance, and usage of Pebble Time colors.
Behind the scenes changes to fix some inefficiencies.
Added H & L under the hi and lo temps to avoid confusion, and adjusted their font size to accommodate triple digit temperatures.

Added degree symbol to current temperature. Moved location to just under the date to accommodate the addition of the timestamp for the last update at the lower right of the screen. Also, added code to cleanly display locations without a state code by replacing the state code with the country code in those instances. Replace some text in the conditions and forecast area with abbreviated text to prevent overrun.

data.description: A simple watchface that prominently displays the current time and temperature (configurable for Fahrenheit or Celsius). Also displayed are the day's high and low temps along with the current conditions. Weather information is pulled from Yahoo!'s API every 30 minutes. Bluetooth and battery indicators are included. Pebble will notify the user with 3 long pulses if Bluetooth connection is lost for more than 10 seconds (e.g. if you forget your phone when you leave the house). It will notify the user with 3 short pulses when it reconnects.

latest_release.release_notes:
You wanted it...you got it!

WeatherFish is now configurable so you can show the temperature in Fahrenheit or Celsius. If you need/want some other scale, build your own app...weirdo.

data.title: WeatherFish

data.description:
Este Watchface nos muestra información:
· Hora en digitos y en formato radial (Circulo central menor horas y central mayor minutos)
· Fecha.
· Nivel de batería en formato radial (Circulo superior derecha). 
· Enlace Bluetooth (Esquina superior Izquierda), si se pierde el enlace el Pebble vibrara con un patron intermitente indicando la perdida de enlace.
· Fase Lunar, grafico y radial indicando la edad de la fase lunar.
· Tiempo.
· Temperatura.
· Viento, esquina inferior izquierda velocidad y esquina inferior derecha direccion.
· Humedad a la izquierda de la fase lunar y presion atmosferica en mm y solo las decenas y unidades a la derecha de la fase lunar.
· Salida de sol (mini circulo relleno sobre el radio de horas y minutos).
· Puesta de sol  (mini circulo sin relleno sobre el radio de horas y minutos).

Tambien hago Apps para iOS, tengo diversos juegos podeis buscarme como Ivan Cerra en la App Store.

latest_release.release_notes: Si el idioma configurado en el Pebble es Ingles, la temperatura se mostrará en Fahrenheit y la velocidad del viento en Nudos.

data.description:
Now supports - English

Wanna go back to XVIII century?

Featuring "Decimal", which includes the standard time and the Decimal time, the french try to include the time units to the Metric standard.

The "Metric" day is split in 10 metric hours, which are split on 100 metric minutes, which at the end are split on 100 metric seconds. Isn't it cool?

Built based on the requests on the Pebble Forums.

data.author: jpdesigns

changelog.release_notes:
First Release
    -The bones but not the makeup

data.description: Used during the French Revolution, Decimal time has 10 hours in a day, 100 minutes in an hour, and 100 seconds per minute. Since decimal time has no practical use other than being an oddity, in the settings, you can have the real time shown in 12 or 24 hr format. Also, in settings you can turn seconds off. Also, you will notice that the decimal time seconds often seem to skip. That is because one decimal second is actually a fraction (0.864) of a normal second and the clock is only updated every normal second.

latest_release.release_notes:
First Release
    -The bones but not the makeup

data.description:
Inspired by the Monty Python's Ministry of Silly Walks sketch, this watchface uses the actual steps of John Cleese's gait to show the time.  Though reordered for better legibility (look where the lifted foot is pointed), the postures indicate the hour, and the cane points to the minutes.  A short double vibration is also given every hour.

Includes images by Jazeen Hollings; icons image by goonofhazzard on DeviantArt.

Like this watchapp? Flattr it at [0].

data.description:
Based on Nintendo's Legend of Zelda, features an AM/PM/24h clock display, day of the week, current date, watch battery meter, charging indicator, and Bluetooth disconnect notification.

AM/PM/24h mode is based on the system setting.

The three hearts in the upper left corner represent the battery remaining on the Pebble.

The magic guage beneath the hearts is a charging indicator, empty (white) when unplugged and discharging, animated filling when plugged in and charging, and full (black) when plugged in and finished charging.

A Bluetooth disconnected icon will appear in the bottom left and the Pebble will vibrate when Bluetooth connection to the phone is lost.

Watchface background and text can be inverted through watchface settings on the My Pebble screen.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Added configuartion menu to invert background colors.
- Minor graphics revisions.

data.author: Peter Summers

changelog.release_notes: Improved accuracy when displaying addresses.
Now updates the health data when it's available rather than each minute.
Fixes a bug with using distance correction and start from a time together and then restarting the watch face.
Updates the battery indicator on a battery state change event, indicates if the battery is charging.
Fixes a problem with the display of accumulated health data after midnight.

Minor tweak to move code that didn't need to run repeatedly out of the tick handler.

N.B.  There are still some weird things going on with statistics changing overnight, but I'm starting to suspect that this is Pebble's issue not mine.  Also, the count metric from now code won't work properly if you have two watches and swap between them.  This is on my to do list.

Total rewrite of the "start counting health metric from now" functionality, after testing it thoroughly, reading the fine print in Pebble's documentation and realizing that the Pebble health function that I was using doesn't work the way you might expect it to.

Allows a correction factor to be specified that corrects Pebble's estimate of the distance walked.  To use this, measure out 1000 metres (or yards) on a map, walk that distance and see what distance Pebble comes up with, enter this number, and if future the distance number will be scaled accordingly.
Now divides the health metric by 1000 and appends a "k" to it if it isn't going to fit in the display space.

Allows the health stats to be set from the current time rather than each midnight so you can, for example, set the start time before you go for a walk and then see the chosen health statistic for the period of the walk at the end.
Fixes a problem with not initializing the run time correctly in the configuration.
Moved the read of local storage into the Ready event and utilized the latest version of Clay that allows me to write to the settings.

Provides a quiet time indicator.

Allows data retrieval every ten minutes.
Adds an option for getting data every two minutes.

Default to showing weather rather than latitude and longitude.

Fixed a problem with reference locations that start with a space.
Another attempt to fix the display color options for Pebble 2.
Fix for the coloring code.
Sets the label to BPM when displaying heart rate.
Uses a larger font for the health units on Pebble Time 2.
Support for the larger screen on a Pebble Time 2.

data.description:
This watch face displays the following:

 - time zone
 - phase of the moon (0-29 days, 0=new, 14=full),
 - location of the moon (0-99 x ~15-minute intervals), or
 - any one of Pebble's health metrics such as steps, distance, active time, sleep, kcal burnt since the time you specify,
 - link status (! if lost), 
 - am/pm
 - battery (0-10), 
 - quiet time status,
 - date, 
 - time, 
and one of
 - latitude, longitude and altitude;
 - distance and direction to a reference point, speed and heading, altitude;
 - street address;
 - weather with temperature, wind and humidity/rainfall; or
 - weather with temperature, air pressure and humidity/rainfall.

If you obtain and enter an API key for Weather Underground in the settings then it will use that instead of OpenWeatherMap.

These are updated every minute, five minutes or half-hour as per your settings, or triggered by a vigorous shake along the Y axis of the watch (6 to 12 o'clock).

The moon location should be accurate to a standard deviation of about five minutes - 0 corresponds to the moon on the opposite side of the earth and 50 to its being at its highest point in the sky.  

The reference location can be specified in degrees (e.g. -35.34532 124.45221), in degrees and minutes (e.g. -35,20.342 124,26.345), in degrees, minutes and seconds (e.g. -35,20,21 124,26,20) or as a street address that will be handed to Google to resolve.

The display is designed for people with poor eyesight or reading under low light.

If you make any enhancements to this, please send me a copy.  If you like it, please give it a heart.
data.title: Moon, Health, Location and Weather Watch
